claim.text: At Muir Commons in Davis, California — the first purpose-built American cohousing, completed in 1991
claim.claim: Muir Commons in Davis, California was the first purpose-built American cohousing community, completed in 1991

results.summary: Muir Commons in Davis, California is widely recognized as the first purpose-built cohousing community in the United States, completed in 1991.
results.detail: This claim is well-documented in cohousing literature and history. Muir Commons was completed in 1991 and is consistently cited as the first purpose-built cohousing community in America. The community was developed based on the Danish cohousing model that architects Kathryn McCamant and Charles Durrett introduced to the United States. Some sources note that while construction began in 1990, the community was completed and residents moved in during 1991.
sources: Cohousing Association of the United States historical records
General cohousing literature and academic sources on intentional communities
